name: Padded Armor
description:
A simple quilted jacket made of thick, padded cloth. It offers minimal protection but is quiet and flexible. It provides +1 Armor.

Lightweight

(Passive)

This armor does not impose disadvantage on DEX rolls for stealth or acrobatics. When you use the Disengage action, you may move an additional square.

name: Scout's Jerkin
description:
A simple sleeveless jacket of tough, boiled leather, designed for mobility above all else. It provides +1 Armor.

Swift Traveler

(Passive)

This armor does not count towards your Load. Your base SPEED is increased by 1.

name: Ornate Noble's Garb
description:
A lavish, fashionable outfit made of fine silks and velvets. It offers no real protection but makes a powerful social statement. It provides +0 Armor.

First Impression

(Passive)

When you first meet someone in a civilized setting, you have advantage on your initial CHA roll to interact with them.

name: Studded Leather Armor
description:
Boiled leather reinforced with metal studs, offering a balance of protection and flexibility. It provides +1 Armor.

Acrobat's Leathers

(Passive)

This armor does not impose disadvantage on DEX rolls for stealth or acrobatics. When you successfully Defy Danger using DEX to avoid an attack, you may immediately Shift 1 square.

name: Hide Armor
description:
Crude armor made from the thick hides of beasts. It's heavy and cumbersome, but offers decent protection. It provides +1 Armor and is clumsy.

Primal Resilience

(Reaction) When you take damage that would reduce you to 0 HP, you can spend your reaction to roll+CON.

  • On a 16+: You endure the blow and are left with 1d6 HP instead.
  • On a 9-15: You are left with 1 HP.
  • On a 1-8: You fall to 0 HP as normal, but you gain advantage on your Last Breath roll.

name: Bolas
description:
A throwing weapon made of weights on the ends of interconnected cords, designed to wrap around and entangle a target's legs. Range: Ranged (5 squares).

Tangle

When you use your action to throw the bolas at a target, spend 1 HP and roll+DEX.

  • On a 16+: You perfectly entangle the target. They are Immobilized for 2 rounds.
  • On a 9-15: The target is entangled but can still move carefully. They are Slowed for 2 rounds.
  • On a 1-8: You miss, but the bolas clatter on the ground, creating a 1-square area of difficult terrain.

name: Javelin
description:
A light spear designed for throwing. Can also be used in melee. Range: Melee (1 square) or Ranged (8 squares).

Piercing Throw

When you make a Volley attack with this weapon, you can spend 1 HP (stamina) to throw with extra force. If the attack hits, it ignores 1 point of the target's Armor. On a High Hit (16+), it ignores 2 points of Armor instead.

name: Throwing Hammer
description:
A set of three light hammers, perfectly balanced for throwing. Favored by dwarven skirmishers. Range: Ranged (4 squares).

Stunning Throw

When you make a Volley attack, you can spend 1 HP (stamina) to throw with concussive force. Roll+STR instead of DEX.

  • On a 16+: You deal your HD. If the target's COS is less than your STR, they are also Stunned for 1 round.
  • On a 9-15: You deal your HD.
  • On a 1-8: You deal half your HD, but the throw is awkward and you cannot easily retrieve the hammer.

name: Cutlass
description:
A short, broad saber or slashing sword, with a straight or slightly curved blade sharpened on the cutting edge, and a hilt often featuring a solid cupped or basket-shaped guard. Range: Melee (1 square).

Flourish

When you use your action to perform a dazzling flourish, spend 1 SP and roll+CHA.

  • On a 16+: Your display is breathtaking. You and all allies gain advantage on your next roll.
  • On a 9-15: Your display is impressive. You gain advantage on your next roll.
  • On a 1-8: You look foolish. You are Weakened for 1 round.

name: Spear
description:
A simple pole weapon with a pointed tip, one of the most ancient and reliable tools of war and hunting. Range: Melee (2 squares, Reach).

Set for Charge

When you use your action to set your spear against a charging enemy, roll+STR.

  • On a 16+: You perfectly time your brace. The enemy's movement ends when they enter your reach, and they take double the damage from your Attack of Opportunity.
  • On a 9-15: You brace, but not perfectly. The enemy's movement ends, and your Attack of Opportunity deals normal damage.
  • On a 1-8: You are too slow. The enemy completes their charge, and their attack against you has advantage.

name: Shortbow
description:
A small, lightweight bow, easier to use in close quarters or from horseback than its larger cousins. Range: Ranged (10 squares).

Rapid Shot

When you make a Volley attack, you can spend 1 HP (stamina) to quickly fire two arrows instead of one. Make a second, separate attack roll against the same target.

  • On any hit: The arrows deal half your HD each.
  • On a 1-8 on either roll: One of your arrows flies wide and hits the nearest creature to your target (friend or foe) for 1d4 damage.

name: Throwing Axes
description:
A set of three light, balanced axes designed to be thrown. Range: Ranged (4 squares).

You can devote crystals to this item to unlock its hidden potential.

Whirling Axes

When you use your action to throw an axe, you can spend 2 HP (stamina) to throw two at once. Make a separate Volley attack roll against two different targets within 2 squares of each other.

name: Blowgun
description:
A long, narrow tube for firing light darts over short distances. It is nearly silent but lacks the power to penetrate armor. Range: Ranged (4 squares).

Venom Dart

When you make a Volley attack with a poisoned dart, roll+DEX.

  • On a 16+: You deal no damage, but the target is Poisoned for 3 rounds, taking 1d4 damage each round. If their CON is less than your DEX, they are also Slowed for the duration.
  • On a 9-15: The target is Poisoned for 2 rounds.
  • On a 1-8: The dart hits but only delivers a partial dose; the target is Poisoned for 1 round.

name: Improvised Caber
description:
A heavy log, a small tree, or a stone pillar you've ripped from the ground. It's clumsy but devastating. Range: Melee (2 squares, Reach).

Unwieldy Swing

When you make a Hack & Slash attack with this weapon, spend 2 HP. You have disadvantage on your roll.

  • On any hit: You deal your HD + 5 and may Push 2 your target.
  • On a Low Hit (1-8): You also lose your balance and are Stunned for 1 round.

name: Boomerang
description:
A curved piece of hardwood designed to return to the thrower when thrown correctly. Range: Ranged (5 squares).

Returning Throw

When you make a Volley attack with this weapon, roll+DEX.

  • On a 16+: You deal your HD, and the boomerang returns perfectly to your hand.
  • On a 9-15: You deal your HD, but the boomerang clatters to the ground in the target's square.
  • On a 1-8: You deal half your HD, but the boomerang flies off in a random direction 1d4 squares away from the target.

name: Weighted Net
description:
A heavy rope net with lead weights on the edges, designed to entangle and immobilize a target. Range: Ranged (3 squares).

Ensnare

When you use your action to throw the net at a creature, spend 1 HP and roll+DEX.

  • On a 16+: The target is Immobilized for 2 rounds or until they or an ally spend an action to untangle them.
  • On a 9-15: The target is Immobilized for 1 round.
  • On a 1-8: You get tangled in your own net and are Immobilized for 1 round.

name: Warhammer
description:
A one-handed hammer with a heavy, dense head for crushing blows and a sharp spike for piercing armor. Range: Melee (1 square).

Staggering Blow

When you make a Hack & Slash attack, you can spend 1 HP (stamina). On a hit, if the target's COS is less than your STR, they are Weakened for 1 round.

name: Sling
description:
A simple leather strap used to hurl small stones or lead bullets. Ammunition is plentiful, but it requires great skill to use effectively. Range: Ranged (8 squares).

Ricochet Shot

When you make a Volley attack, you can choose to target a hard surface near an enemy instead of the enemy directly. Roll+DEX with disadvantage.

  • On a 16+: You deal your HD. The target cannot use a shield against this attack, and it ignores 1 point of armor.
  • On a 9-15: You deal your HD, but the ricochet is wild.
  • On a 1-8: The shot goes wide and gives away your position.

name: Scythe
description:
A farmer's tool with a long, curving blade, repurposed for war. Its wide, sweeping arc is terrifying to face. Range: Melee (2 squares, Reach).

Reap

When you make a Hack & Slash attack, you can spend 2 HP to sweep the scythe in a wide arc. You may target up to two adjacent enemies in your reach, making a separate attack roll against each.

name: Pitchfork
description:
A common farming implement with long tines, surprisingly effective at keeping foes at a distance. Range: Melee (2 squares, Reach).

Keep Away!

When you use the Defend action with this weapon, you may spend hold 1-for-1. On your turn, instead of a normal choice, you can spend 1 hold to Push 1 an adjacent enemy.

name: Battleaxe
description:
A heavy, single-bladed axe designed for warfare. Range: Melee (1 square).

Armor Breaker

When you attack a target wearing heavy armor (like mail or plate), roll+STR.

  • On a 16+: You deal your HD, and the target's armor is permanently reduced by 1.
  • On a 9-15: You deal your HD, but only reduce their armor by 1 for the next attack.
  • On a 1-8: You deal half your HD, but your axe gets stuck, leaving you Weakened for 1 round.

name: Longsword
description:
A versatile and balanced blade, favored by knights and soldiers. Range: Melee (1 square).

Riposte

(Reaction) When an enemy rolls a Low Hit (1-8) on a melee attack against you, you can spend your reaction to counter. Roll+DEX.

  • On a 16+: You deal your full HD.
  • On a 9-15: You deal half your HD.
  • On a 1-8: Your counter is clumsy and you become Weakened for 1 round.

name: Simple Bow
description:
A standard wooden bow used by hunters and militia. Range: Ranged (12 squares).

Distracting Shot

When you use your action to fire an arrow to create a diversion, choose a point within 10 squares and roll+DEX.

  • On a 16+: Your arrow strikes a surface with a loud noise. All enemies near that point are distracted and turn to face it, becoming Weakened for 1 round.
  • On a 9-15: You create a minor distraction. One enemy is distracted and becomes Weakened.
  • On a 1-8: Your shot gives away your position.

name: Dagger
description:
A small, easily concealed blade. Range: Melee (1 square).

Precise Strike

When you attack an enemy that is unaware of you or flanked, your attack has the Brutal property (roll damage twice, take the best result).

name: Gambeson Armor
description:
A thick, padded cloth armor that offers basic protection and mobility. It provides +1 Armor.

Cushioning

(Reaction) When you take HD from a blunt weapon (like a mace or hammer) or from falling, you can spend your reaction to roll+CON.

  • On a 16-19: You reduce the damage to zero.
  • On a 9-15: You reduce the damage by half (rounded down).
  • On a Miss: You take the full damage.

Stealthy Padding

Effect Type: Passive

The padded cloth muffles your movements. You do not have disadvantage on rolls to be stealthy while wearing this armor.

name: Round Shield
description:
A simple, versatile shield held in one hand. It provides +1 Armor.

Shield Bash

When you attack an enemy in melee with your shield instead of a weapon, roll+STR.

  • On a 16-19: You deal 1d6 HD and the target is Stunned for 1 round.
  • On a 9-15: You deal 1d6 HD.
  • On a Miss: You overextend, leaving you Weakened for 1 round.

Final Stand

(Reaction) When an attack would reduce you to 0 HP, you can shatter your shield. The shield is destroyed, but you ignore all damage from the attack.

name: Kite Shield
description:
A long, teardrop-shaped shield offering excellent protection, especially for cavalry. It provides +1 Armor.

Cover from Fire

(Reaction) When you or an adjacent ally are targeted by a ranged attack, you can spend your reaction to Defend. Roll+CON.

  • On a 16-19: The attack is completely blocked.
  • On a 9-15: The attack's damage is halved.
  • On a Miss: You get in the way, and the attack deals full damage to you instead of the intended target.

name: Buckler
description:
A small, agile shield strapped to the forearm, used for parrying. It provides +1 Armor.

Quick Parry

(Reaction) When an enemy hits you with a melee attack, you can spend your reaction to roll+DEX.

  • On a 16-19: You parry the blow, taking no damage, and create an opening, granting you advantage on your next melee attack against that enemy.
  • On a 9-15: You parry the blow, taking no damage.
  • On a Miss: Your parry fails and you take the full damage.

Dodge and Weave

When you Defend, you may roll+DEX instead of+CON. If you do, you cannot use the 'Redirect an attack' option, but you can choose to 'move 1 square' when you spend hold.

name: Adventuring Gear
description:
A pack filled with miscellaneous but useful adventuring supplies: rope, torches, chalk, flint & steel, etc. It has 5 uses.

In a timed scene, you can 'Find What You Need'.

Find What You Need

When you spend an action to rummage through your gear for a specific mundane item, mark off one use and roll+INT.

  • On a 16-19: You have just the thing! You can use the item as a free action this turn.
  • On a 9-15: You have something close enough, but it takes your whole turn to find and use it.
  • On a Miss: You pull out the wrong thing or drop everything, making a mess and leaving yourself open.

name: Bag of Books
description:
A satchel containing a handful of scholarly texts and reference guides. Has 3 uses.

In a timed scene, you can 'Cite a Source'.

Cite a Source

When you spend an action to consult a book about a creature you are fighting, mark off a use and roll+INT.

  • On a 16-19: You find a key weakness. You and your allies gain +3 forward against the creature for 1 round.
  • On a 9-15: You find a minor detail. You gain +3 forward against the creature.
  • On a Miss: You find conflicting or incorrect information, and are Confused for 1 round.

name: Pipeleaf
description:
A pouch of fine, aromatic herbs from the Southfarthing, beloved by gnomes. Has 5 uses.

In a tense social situation, you can 'Share a Smoke'.

Share a Smoke

When you offer to share your pipeleaf with an NPC, spend 2 uses and roll+CHA.

  • On a 16-19: They relax and become friendly, giving you advantage on your next social roll against them.
  • On a 9-15: They accept, but are not so easily swayed. You gain +3 forward on your next social roll.
  • On a Miss: They are offended by the offer or dislike the smoke. You have disadvantage on your next social roll against them.

name: Bandages
description:
A roll of clean linen bandages for treating wounds. Has 3 uses.

In a timed scene, you can 'Patch Up' an ally.

Patch Up

When you spend an action to apply a bandage to an adjacent creature, mark off one use and roll+WIS.

  • On a 16-19: The target heals 1d8+1 HP.
  • On a 9-15: The target heals 1d8 HP.
  • On a Miss: You apply the bandage incorrectly, and it has no effect.

name: Oil
description:
A flask of flammable oil. Can be used to light a lantern, or as a weapon in a pinch. Single use.

In a timed scene, you can 'Throw Oil'.

Throw Oil

When you spend an action to throw the flask at a square within 4 squares, roll+DEX.

  • On a 16-19: You hit the square and the 4 adjacent squares are now covered in oil, becoming difficult terrain. If this area is hit with fire, it erupts in flames, dealing 1d6 MD (fire) to anyone in it.
  • On a 9-15: You only cover a 2x2 area.
  • On a Miss: You drop the flask at your feet, covering your square in oil.

This item is consumed on use.

name: Throwing Knives
description:
A set of balanced, light knives designed to be thrown. This card represents a bundle of 3 knives.

In a timed scene, you can 'Throw Knife'.

Throw Knife

When you throw a knife at an enemy within 4 squares, mark off one knife and roll+DEX.

  • On a 16-19: You deal 1d4 HD.
  • On a 9-15: You deal 1d4 HD, but your throw leaves you exposed.
  • On a Miss: Your throw misses completely.

name: Torch
description:
A wooden stick tipped with cloth soaked in pitch. Provides light in a 3-square radius for about an hour.

Torch Bearer

When you use the torch as an improvised melee weapon (1d4 HD), roll+STR.

  • On a 16-19: You deal your HD and the target is Blinded by the flame for 1 round.
  • On a 9-15: You deal your HD, but the torch is extinguished.
  • On a Miss: You drop the torch at your feet, setting your own square on fire.

The Torch Reveals

When you use your torch to investigate a dark area, roll+WIS.

  • On a 16-19: The flickering light reveals a hidden detail; ask the GM one question from the Discern Realities list.
  • On a 9-15: You notice something, but the shadows play tricks on your eyes.
  • On a Miss: The shadows seem to writhe, and you lose 1d4 SP.

name: Healing Poultice
description:
A single-use bundle of crushed herbs that can be applied to a wound to promote rapid healing.

In a timed scene, you 'Apply Poultice'.

Apply Poultice

When you spend an action to apply this to yourself or an adjacent creature, roll+WIS.

  • On a 16-19: The target heals 1d8+3 HP.
  • On a 9-15: The target heals 1d8 HP.
  • On a Miss: You apply it poorly; it only heals 1d4 HP.

This item is consumed on use.

name: Dwarven Hardtack Ration
description:
A single ration of incredibly dense, dry bread that can last for years. It's tough and bland, but filling.

In a timed scene, you can 'Chomp on Hardtack'.

Chomp on Hardtack

When you spend an action to eat this ration, roll+CON.

  • On a 16-19: You power through. You heal 1d4 HP and gain +3 forward on your next STR or CON roll.
  • On a 9-15: You heal 1d4 HP.
  • On a Miss: You almost break a tooth and waste your action.

This item is consumed on use.

name: Riding Horse
description:
A sturdy horse trained for riding, not for battle. It can carry one rider and their gear across long distances much faster than walking.

In a timed scene, you can use 'Gallop'.

Gallop

As an action, you can command your horse to gallop. Roll+DEX.

  • On a 16-19: You move up to three times your normal SPEED.
  • On a 9-15: You move up to double your SPEED, but the horse is winded and cannot gallop next turn.
  • On a Miss: The horse is spooked and bolts 1d6 squares in a random direction.

name: Mastiff
description:
A large, loyal dog known for its guarding instincts. It can track scents and will defend its master fiercely.

In a timed scene, you can command it to 'Pin Down'.

Pin Down

When you command your mastiff to attack a target within its SPEED, roll+DEX.

  • On a 16-19: The mastiff deals 1d6 HD and the target is Immobilized as long as the dog continues to use its action to pin them.
  • On a 9-15: The mastiff deals 1d6 HD, but fails to pin the target.
  • On a Miss: The target kicks the dog away; the mastiff takes 1d6 HD.

name: Mule
description:
A stubborn but incredibly sturdy pack animal. A mule can carry an immense amount of gear (doubles your character's Load capacity) but is unwilling to charge headfirst into danger.

In a timed scene, it can be coaxed into a 'Stubborn Shove'.

Stubborn Shove

When you spend an action to convince your mule to shove an adjacent creature, roll+CHA.

  • On a 16-19: The mule begrudgingly shoves the target with its full weight, inflicting Push 2 and knocking them prone.
  • On a 9-15: The mule gives a half-hearted shove, inflicting Push 1.
  • On a Miss: The mule refuses and brays loudly, attracting unwanted attention.

name: Ferret
description:
A sly and nimble creature, small enough to fit in a pocket. It is naturally curious and can be trained to fetch small items or navigate tight spaces inaccessible to humanoids.

In a timed scene, you can command it to 'Distracting Scurry'.

Distracting Scurry

When you command your ferret to harry a target within its SPEED, roll+DEX.

  • On a 16-19: The ferret zips around the target's feet, making them Weakened for 2 rounds.
  • On a 9-15: The target is Weakened for 1 round.
  • On a Miss: The ferret gets scared and scurries back to you, unable to be commanded for the rest of the combat.

name: Hedge Knight
description:
A wandering knight of no renown, pledging their sword for coin and a cause. Their loyalty is firm, so long as their pay is on time. Their basic attack deals 1d8 HD.

You can devote crystals to this hireling to command them in special ways.

Protect the Patron

(Reaction) When an enemy attacks you, you can command your Hedge Knight to intercept the blow. They roll+CON.

  • On a 16-19: The Knight flawlessly intercepts the attack, becoming the new target and taking only half damage.
  • On a 9-15: The Knight intercepts, but takes the full brunt of the attack for you.
  • On a Miss: The Knight stumbles, failing to intercept, and the attack against you has advantage.

name: Crossbow Mercenary
description:
A grim professional with a heavy crossbow and a steady hand. They care little for morality, but their aim is true as long as they are paid. Their basic ranged attack deals 1d8 HD.

You can devote crystals to this hireling to command them in special ways.

Crippling Shot

When you command the mercenary to fire a debilitating shot, they roll+DEX.

  • On a 16-19: The bolt hits a leg or joint. The mercenary deals their damage and the target is Immobilized for 2 rounds.
  • On a 9-15: The shot is a glancing blow. The mercenary deals their damage, and the target is only Slowed for 1 round.
  • On a Miss: The shot goes wide, alerting other enemies to your position.

name: Sellsword Brawler
description:
A tavern tough who solves problems with their fists and a lack of subtlety. Likes drinking, getting paid, and starting fights. Their basic unarmed attack deals 1d6 HD.

You can devote crystals to this hireling to command them in special ways.

Pummel

When you command the brawler to pummel an adjacent target, they roll+STR.

  • On a 16-19: The brawler deals their HD and the target is both Weakened and Stunned for 1 round.
  • On a 9-15: The brawler deals their HD and the target is only Weakened.
  • On a Miss: The brawler swings wide, leaving themselves open and becoming Weakened for 1 round.

name: Kobold 'Trap Expert'
description:
A yipping, cowardly kobold who has sworn allegiance to you for protection. Surprisingly adept at creating makeshift, annoying traps. Their basic dagger attack deals 1d4 HD.

You can devote crystals to this hireling to command them in special ways.

Cobble-a-Trap!

When you command the kobold to rig a trap in an adjacent empty square, they roll+DEX.

  • On a 16-19: The kobold creates a clever trap. The first enemy to enter the square is either Immobilized for 1 round or takes 1d8 HD (your choice).
  • On a 9-15: The trap is simpler. It deals 1d8 HD but has no other effect.
  • On a Miss: The kobold accidentally triggers their own trap and becomes Immobilized for 1 round.

name: Disgruntled Farmer
description:
A stout farmer armed with a pitchfork and a lifetime of grievances. They're not a warrior, but they know how to handle unruly livestock—and people. Their basic pitchfork attack deals 1d6 HD with Reach.

You can devote crystals to this hireling to command them in special ways.

Get Off My Land!

When you command the farmer to drive an enemy back, they roll+STR.

  • On a 16-19: They jab with their pitchfork, dealing their damage and inflicting Push 2.
  • On a 9-15: They inflict Push 2 but deal no damage.
  • On a Miss: They get their pitchfork stuck and are Disarmed until they can retrieve it.

name: Rat Catcher & 'Terrier'
description:
A wiry slum-dweller accompanied by a vicious-looking dog of questionable breed. An expert on sewers, alleyways, and vermin of all sizes. Their basic attack is a club for 1d4 HD.

You can devote crystals to this hireling to command them in special ways.

Sic 'Em!

When you command the rat catcher to release their dog on an enemy within 4 squares, they roll+DEX.

  • On a 16-19: The dog latches on, dealing 1d6 HD and making the target Immobilized and Weakened for 1 round.
  • On a 9-15: The dog bites for 1d6 HD but does not latch on.
  • On a Miss: The dog gets confused and runs back to the rat catcher, refusing to attack for the rest of the combat.

name: Simple Cart
description:
A two-wheeled cart pulled by a stubborn donkey or pony. Slow and humble, but better than walking. It can carry a driver and a hefty load of goods.

You can devote crystals to this vehicle to unlock its special abilities.

Heave-ho!

When you command the donkey to make a stubborn push, roll+CHA.

  • On a 16-19: The donkey shoves forward with surprising force. You can Push 2 an object or creature in front of the cart.
  • On a 9-15: The donkey manages a shove for Push 1.
  • On a Miss: The donkey refuses to move and brays loudly, attracting unwanted attention.

name: Alpinist's Pitons & Hammer
description:
A set of 10 hardened steel spikes (pitons) and a weighted hammer. Used to create temporary anchor points in rock fissures for securing ropes. Each use requires several minutes of careful work outside of combat.

You can devote crystals to this item to unlock its special abilities.

Set Anchor

When you spend an action to quickly hammer a piton into a stone surface in your square, roll+STR.

  • On a 16+: You set a solid anchor. You or an ally using the anchor cannot be unwillingly moved by Push or Pull effects for 2 rounds.
  • On a 9-15: The anchor is set, but it's temporary. It works against the next Push or Pull effect, then breaks.
  • On a 1-8: The rock fractures. The piton fails to hold, and the square becomes difficult terrain.

name: Explorer's Bedroll
description:
A well-made, weatherproof bedroll made from oiled canvas and packed wool. It ensures a relatively dry and warm rest even in harsh conditions, which is crucial for maintaining morale and recovering from exhaustion.

Using this item enhances the Take a Rest move.

A Good Night's Sleep

(Passive)

When you Take a Rest using this bedroll, you may choose one additional benefit from the list, even if the rest was not comfortable or peaceful.

name: Alchemical Purifier Vial
description:
A single-use vial containing two reactive agents separated by a thin membrane. Breaking the membrane and shaking the vial primes it. When poured into up to five gallons of liquid, it neutralizes common poisons and purifies stagnant water in seconds.

In a timed scene, you can use it to 'Neutralize Toxin'.

Neutralize Toxin

When you use your action to apply the purifier to a creature, roll+INT.

  • On a 16+: You successfully cure one Poisoned condition affecting the target.
  • On a 9-15: You suppress the effects of a Poisoned condition for 3 rounds.
  • On a 1-8: The alchemical reaction is volatile, dealing 1d4 acid damage to both you and the target.

name: Sunrod
description:
A 1-foot-long alchemical rod with a capped end. When you strike the cap, the rod instantly produces bright, unwavering light in a 5-square radius for one hour. It is a single-use item.

In a timed scene, you can 'Strike to Flare'.

Strike to Flare

When you spend an action to strike the sunrod, roll+DEX.

  • On a 16+: The rod flares brilliantly. All creatures within a 2-square radius are Blinded for 1 round. The rod then sheds its normal light.
  • On a 9-15: The flare is less intense. All creatures in the radius are Weakened for 1 round.
  • On a 1-8: The rod is a dud. It sputters and produces only dim light in its square for one hour.

name: Climber's Harness
description:
A harness of thick leather straps and metal buckles that distributes weight, making climbing safer and allowing a climber to anchor themselves to a rope. It must be worn to be effective.

You can devote crystals to this item to unlock its special abilities.

Belay

(Reaction) When you are anchored and an adjacent, roped ally would fall, you can spend your reaction to arrest their fall. Roll+DEX.

  • On a 16+: You expertly catch them, stopping their fall completely.
  • On a 9-15: You stop their fall, but the sudden jolt strains your anchor point or throws you off balance. You are Weakened for 1 round.
  • On a 1-8: The rope slips. You only slow their fall (they take half damage), and you are pulled prone.

name: Spyglass
description:
A tube of polished brass with finely ground glass lenses. It allows the user to see objects at a great distance in clear detail, perfect for scouting from a high vantage point.

You can devote crystals to this item to unlock its special abilities.

Spot Weakness

When you spend your action in a timed scene to observe a distant enemy through the spyglass, roll+WIS.

  • On a 16+: You spot a significant flaw in their armor or positioning. You and all allies gain advantage on your next ranged attack against that target.
  • On a 9-15: You spot a minor flaw. You gain advantage on your next ranged attack against that target.
  • On a 1-8: The sun glints off your lens, revealing your position to the enemy.

name: Caltrops
description:
A small leather bag containing two dozen four-pointed iron spikes. When scattered on the ground, they are designed to impede movement by injuring the feet of pursuers or charging enemies. This bag has 3 uses.

In a timed scene, you can 'Scatter Caltrops'.

Scatter Caltrops

When you use your action to scatter caltrops, choose a 2x2 square area adjacent to you. Mark off one use. That area becomes difficult terrain.

  • Any creature that enters the area must roll+DEX. On a 9-15, their SPEED is halved for 1 round. On a 1-8, their SPEED is halved and they take 1d4 damage.

name: Manacles
description:
A set of heavy iron shackles with a complex lock, designed to restrain a humanoid prisoner. Applying them to an unwilling target is difficult, but they are very hard to escape from.

You can devote crystals to this item to unlock its special abilities.

Shackle

When you attempt to apply the manacles to an adjacent creature that is Stunned, Immobilized, or willing, roll+STR.

  • On a 16+: The manacles are secured perfectly. The creature is bound and cannot break free without the key or a successful Pick Lock roll at a disadvantage.
  • On a 9-15: The manacles are on, but not perfectly. The creature can attempt to break free by making a Defy Danger (STR) roll at a disadvantage.
  • On a 1-8: You fumble with the lock. The target is not bound and can make a free Attack of Opportunity against you.

name: Flask of Oil
description:
A simple clay flask containing one pint of flammable oil. Can be used to light a lantern, create a slippery surface, or as an improvised incendiary weapon. Single use.

In a timed scene, you can 'Create Oil Slick'.

Create Oil Slick

When you use your action to pour the oil onto the ground, choose a 2x2 square area adjacent to you. That area becomes difficult terrain.

  • Any creature that enters the area must roll+DEX. On a 9-15, their SPEED is halved for 1 round. On a 1-8, they fall prone. If the area is hit with fire, it becomes Ablaze for 2 rounds.
